name: ListCustomOauth2Scopes
description:
Retrieve all custom OAuth2 token scopes.

This tool is used to list all custom OAuth2 token scopes for a specific authorization server identified by its ID. Call this tool when you need to access or display the custom scopes defined in an OAuth2 authorization server.

parameters.name: authorization_server_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Authorization Server to retrieve custom token scopes.

parameters.name: query_custom_scope_name
parameters.description: Search for custom token scopes by matching values in their names.

value_schema.description: Searches the `name` of Custom Token Scopes for matching values

parameters.name: custom_token_scopes_filter
parameters.description: Filter the list of custom token scopes using a specific expression.

value_schema.description: Filter expression for Custom Token Scopes

parameters.name: pagination_cursor_next_page
parameters.description: Specify the pagination cursor for fetching the next page of scopes. Use the cursor from the next link as an opaque value.

value_schema.description:
Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of scopes.
Treat the after cursor as an opaque value and obtain it through the next link relationship. See [Pagination](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#pagination).

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of OAuth2 scopes to return per page. Handles pagination automatically.

value_schema.description:
Specifies the number of objects to return per page.
If there are multiple pages of results, the Link header contains a `next` link that you need to use as an opaque value (follow it, don't parse it). See [Pagination](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#pagination).
